TopicTitle: Can't click on buildings after hiring more kerbals

Articles.Content:
I'm playing in sandbox, I have some 12 or something kerbals already assigned and, since I'm running out of kerbonauts, I go to the Astronaut Complex, either from the Space Center, the VAB or the Launchpad to add some more. The kerbals add, and once they do, I can no longer access any buildings.

Here's the output.log file

https://mega.co.nz/#!8cVQjRDD!8pvsMtD7iOtBEMTdExLJ-mu3gnYfHPaYMO6RIXK7CQE

And the mod list

Ambient Light Adjustment - 1.3.1.1

Chatterer - 0.8.0.86

Community Resource Pack - 0.3.2

Editor Extensions - 2.5

Firespitter - 7.0

Kerbal Engineer Redux 1.0 - 1.0.14.1

HyperEdit - 1.3

KSP-AVC Plugin - 1.1.5

Modular Rocket Systems - 1.4.4

Pilot Assistant - 0.9.6.2

RCS Build Aid - 0.5.4

RealChute - 1.2.6.3

Regolith - 0.1.2

SCANsat - 1.0.9.41

TAC Fuel Balancer - 2.4.1.1008

Karbonite - 0.5.1

Filter Extensions 1.10

Blizzy's Toolbar 1.7.8

BetterBuoyancy 1.0

DDS Loader 1.7

Fusebox 1.2

K2 Command Pod, no version listed

KAS 0.4.7

KAX 2.3.2

Kethane 0.9.2

Layered Animations 1.0.5388.30965

Infernal Robotcis 0.19.3

Docking Port Alignment 1.0

No More Grind 1.1.0.0

NRAP 1.5.0.2

Precise Node 1.1.2

StockBugFix Modules 0.1.5c

Targetron 1.0

Toadicus Tools, no version listed

Kerbal Alarm Clock 2.7.3.0

Tweak Scale 1.5

I think it's more likely a stock problem rather than a mod one, though

Edited January 2, 2015 by juanml82
Ok, so I removed all applicants in the astronaut complex, hired new guys and the issue went away, at least so far.

For me, this always happens after I change someone's name who is also referenced elsewhere in the save. Like, if I rename someone I save from Orbit.

The only way to rename people is in the persistent file (or by a mod) so if you haven't been doing that then I'm not sure what it could be.

For me, this always happens after I change someone's name who is also referenced elsewhere in the save. Like, if I rename someone I save from Orbit.

The only way to rename people is in the persistent file (or by a mod) so if you haven't been doing that then I'm not sure what it could be.

Nope, I didn't edit the savefile, so no idea what caused it. Fortunately, the solution was easy, once I thought of that.
